item.title: How to define aesthetic mappings of ggplot2 within another function
item.description: ggplot2 is great for visualization, but sometimes we need to include ggplot2 functions within another function. ggplot() uses aes() to define aesthetic mappings of different variables. The question is: how to define aesthetic mappings when writing functions using ggplot()? In this post I will present several approaches.
